title: To see if Toplane really has no agency over the game, I'll be playing supports in the top lane
body:
Simply holding off the opponent from my tower to the best of my ability and waiting until mid game to group with my team and be a healbot for my adc.

First testing will be with {{champion:16}}  with her global ult.

Wish me luck.

Because your asserting that you can't replace a champion if they retain the same role, even though there's no reason to agree to such an assertion.

If i took all of {{champion:40}} skills, and gave her all of {{champion:267}} skills (mechanically speaking), then would i have "removed ... and replaced" Janna?

I think that big part of the 'problem' people run into is due to attitude of how game is played. That is, they play fighting game in top lane which just happens to be situated in Summoners Rift. Rather than playing the actual game. Second issue, prevalent in lower elos which ties with previously stated, is that people don't understand what laning phase is. Laning phase is for getting gold and denying gold to your opponent. That's the core fundamental. Not kills, not outplays, bug gold. Kills and outplays may help to deny gold, but you won't transit to impactful mid game if you wasted your time chasing KDA around.

Second part of the big issue, which I think is unsolvable given how it's being handled, is bruisers being more and more useless as the game develops. Game went forward a lot. Mixed arms / team fighting became standard, well, because it simply works. It's more efficient. And such team compositions favor specialists, not jack of all trades which many bruisers tend to lean towards.

So unless you'll find what kind of unique stuff bruisers can bring to the table of mixed arms team composition on their own, there is nothing which can be done without breaking or gutting other elements of the game. Or making champions broken OP. Make bruisers more tanky? Tanks will be pointless. Make bruisers more damagy, carries will become pointless. Make them balanced? there will be no point of picking bruisers over any of the other specialists. Good example of things getting broken was tri-force ekko / fizz in season 6. By buffing bruisers directly you'll end up with similar result.

So why people don't take another carry top lane? Because it's a dangerous long lane, which mid laners / carries have difficulty surviving given very long chase distance.

And it's not something "rito did". Nope, it's the path the player-base moved towards due to them improving and learning the game. Back in season 2 game was very dynamic because many people even in top ranks have no idea what they were doing. I can sypathize with frustration, but in my view, none of the changes being proposed solves the issue and we are still stuck in perpetual cycle and will remain so with added collateral damage  if random changes will be implemented based on whines "I have bad experience". Pointing to recent hashinshin drama.

Wow, people down-voting you for typing real and sensible stuff. It's been a while since I agreed with a random person on these boards as much as you. Of course, I just agreed with your first paragraph for the most part.

Everyone wants to complain about dying a few times to enemy jungle, but no one wants to take courage and keep pushing anyway. No one wants to use teleport to help the team get something done while the opposing teleport got used to wreck them, resulting in a single death for their team as opposed to potentially more than one for the enemy team trying to get dragon or going on a big chase.

Sadly, I feel like some people play bottom like it's a shooter game, the same issue that top lane has. Don't play a team strategy game without remembering what kind of game it is, or you're going to frustrate your allies.

But really, bruisers are not in such a bad spot. There's a reason the pros commonly buy Black Cleaver in the top lane. So they can enhance the damage of their ADC at bottom lane. So they can support their team. Just because one slot is labeled 'support' doesn't mean other champs don't support the team. To be more accurate, that slot should be called lane support. There are other item choices that a bruiser can get which will often give more benefit to both them and the team if bought on them compared to say a lane support buying them, such as Righteous Glory and Locket of the Iron Solari. Do those items give them glorious damage? No, but they subtract from the opposing team's damage, and that counts for more than many players are willing to admit.

They also fail to acknowledge how much impact their champ can have in team fights. Because they don't care about their team's potential. They don't care about the K/D/A of the rest of their team, only their own K/D/A. Wasting time trying to pad your K/D/A may result in significant sacrifices of your teammates that you may not be prepared to handle in future events.

This doesn't make sense.

It's been long known that Soraka can solo lane well and hold her own. Even Janna can (sans the waveclear) and Lulu.

So what's the point?
Something about team fighting being more important  than split pushing might be the basis of reasoning on his part that his attempt would be successful.

I thought more top laners hated being relegated to splitpushing than teamfighting, because some can be kited so easily, also with the existence of supports and the inherent advantage ranged champions have over melees? I guess the opinions are quite diverse, so it was a bit of a crap assumption of mine to make.

I guess a lot of people don't have a sensible plan. I prefer to play top lane with the attitude that I can do whatever my team needs me to do, which is usually a moderate amount of everything. If you're pushing nonstop, your allies might end up with too few minions slain to finish their build. If you're team fighting nonstop, your team might just get pushed and you could lose to a Rift Herald push or simply get cornered from lack of map control.

Adapting to the situation is important and most people that complain about top lane don't know what the word adapt means or they refuse to learn how to do it.
I used to play Leo jng in 3c3, that was beautiful.

i knidof hope this is a joke, but in case its not.

first of all, picking a champion with a global ult to prove that top laners have agency is kindof silly (and why i hope youre just being sarcastic).

the problem with this experiment is, that the most effective champions on top lane are already supports in nature.

the main reason imo why the top lane meta is a tank meta atm is because tanks dont need to win lane and farm a lot of gold to be relevant. in fact, they often forfeit their turret in favour of a roam play to get their bot lane ahead. because getting their adc fed is their main win condition. (sound familiar anyone?)

in teamfights they make themselves relevant through their kit innate utility and by lockdown and peel.

so by playing supports on top lane, youre already playing champions who are very similar to the currently most effective top laners, because theyre playing into how overpowered bot lane is at the moment.

the top laners that really have problems with game agency are mostly fighters and skirmishers. because their win condition at the moment is not only to win their lane, but to do so and grab turret first blood gold before one of the bot lanes can win it for themselves. otherwise they dont get enough gold for their items to keep up in strength with bot lane.

bruisers have the same role on a team as marksmen as they act as carries. but when marksmen 3 items are 1000 gold cheaper than 3 items on a bruiser, they have difficulty to make themselves relevant before they get heavily outscaled by theirs or the enemy bot lane. the problem is really how hard and how fast a top lane bruiser has to win his lane to not just be another body on the team whos kindof there.
Karma is really oppressive top lane
